snippet: If the Republicans were to lose the presidency, their party could split. If the Democrats were to lose, their party would probably not regain the House or the Senate.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

lead_paragraph: If the Republicans were to lose the presidency, their party could split. If the Democrats were to lose, their party would probably not regain the House or the Senate.

headline.main: How the 2016 Race Could Affect Each Party’s Future
